alert.note: Alert for San Jacinto; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 9:21PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, San Jacinto and Trinity. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and light to occasionally moderate rain continues to fall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trinity and Sebastopol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
